markdown:
Even bulkier than their non-woolly cousins, these rhinoceroses have a shaggy pelt of long, thick fur and a huge crescent-shaped horn. Woolly rhinos inhabit areas of arid tundra and cold steppes, spending much of their day grazing for sustenance. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 22 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 [Woolly Rhinoceros](/Monsters.aspx?ID=789) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 228 2.0 **Perception** +11; [scent (imprecise) 30 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +16, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +13 **Str** +6 **Dex** +1 **Con** +5 **Int** -4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** -1 --- **AC** 25 **Fort** +17 **Ref** +11 **Will** +15 +2 status to all saves vs. cold **HP** 100 **Cold Adaptation** The woolly rhinoceros treats [environmental cold effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=642) as if they were one step less extreme.
**[Ferocity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=16)** --- **Speed** 35 feet **Melee** horn +16 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d12+6 piercing **Melee** foot +16, **Damage** 2d8+6 bludgeoning **Rhinoceros Charge** The woolly rhinoceros Strides twice, then makes a horn Strike. As long as the woolly rhinoceros moved at least 20 feet, the Strike's damage increases to 3d12+6. A Medium or smaller creature struck by this attack must succeed at a DC 24 Reflex save or be automatically [Shoved](/Actions.aspx?ID=38) back 5 feet and knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) by the force of the blow. **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=39)** Medium or smaller, foot, DC 21
name: Woolly Rhinoceros
